entry.content: Version 5.6.1 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. New: Separate health route.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.6.1 release

entry.content: Version 5.6.0 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. New: Admin user can restict what crates a user can upload.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.6.0 release

entry.content: Version 5.5.0 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. New UI with better design and responsiveness.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.5.0 release

entry.content: Version 5.4.1 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. Fixes a bug where docs are not build due to the crate being in the wrong folder on disk.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.4.1 release

entry.content: Version 5.4.0 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. The biggest new features are: - Read-only users can now be created. - User groups to manage permissions added. - S3 storage backend to save crates added.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.4.0 release

entry.content: Version 5.3.1 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. - Fixed wrong version shown in web ui.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.3.1 release

entry.content: Version 5.3.0 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. - Updated all dependencies to the latest version. - Fixed missing crate descriptions - Fixed empty users and passwords - Added authenitcation for crate downloads - Added new API endpoint to list all crate versions - Made config and static directory configurable
entry.title: Kellnr 5.3.0 release

entry.content: Version 5.2.7 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. Updated all dependencies to the latest version.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.2.7 release

entry.content: Version 5.2.6 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. Cache invalidation if a crate is deleted fixed and error codes for the HTTP API fixed. Updated all dependencies to the latest version.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.2.6 release

entry.content: Version 5.2.5 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. Multiple bug fixes and improvements to increase the performance of the crates.io cache. Missing dependencies in Docker image are now fixed.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.2.5 release

entry.content: Version 5.2.4 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. We switched from Ubuntu as the builder to cross-rs, which allows us to build for multiple platforms. Kellnr has official static (musl) releases, now. Besides that, we fixed some bugs and updated all dependencies.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.2.4 release

entry.content: Version 5.2.3 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. Updates to Ubuntu 24.04 as the base image and fixes some bugs.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.2.3 release

entry.content: Version 5.2.2 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. Contains multiple bug fixes and improvements.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.2.2 release

entry.content: Version 5.2.1 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. Contains multiple bug fixes and improvements.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.2.1 release

entry.content: Version 5.2.0 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. Cached crates can now be shown and searched from the UI. A "delete all" button was added to allow the deletion all versions of a crate.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.2.0 release

entry.content: Version 5.1.2 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. Bug fixes and new crates.io status codes.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.1.3 release

entry.content: Version 5.1.2 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. Bug fixes and dependency updates.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.1.2 release

entry.content: Learn how a native shared C library is wrapped in a cross-platform Rust library and used in a cross-platform Rust application.
entry.title: Wrapping Cross-Platform Native Libraries in Rust

entry.content: Version 5.1.1 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. The new release fixes a bug in the manual upload of rustdocs, where the upload size was miscalculated.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.1.1 release

entry.content: Version 5.1.0 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. New landing page and bug fixes.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.1.0 release

entry.content: Version 5.0.0 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. It switches from rocket.rs to axum, removes the git index support and has refactored settings.
entry.title: Kellnr 5.0.0 release

entry.content: Version 4.0.3 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. This release includes updated dependencies and bug fixes.
entry.title: Kellnr 4.0.3 release

entry.content: Version 4.0.2 of Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is released. This release includes updated dependencies and bug fixes. For more information see the changelog.
entry.title: Kellnr 4.0.2 release

entry.content: Kellnr, the private Rust registry, is now open source under the MIT license.
entry.title: Kellnr goes Open Source

entry.content: Use domain modeling in Rust to achieve separation of concerns, code decoupling and a better understanding of your domain.
entry.title: Leveraging the Type System for Domain Modeling in Rust

entry.content: Kellnr 3.0.0, the private rust registry, is released. This release includes a new UI and many improvements under the hood.
entry.title: Kellnr 3.0.0 Release

entry.content: What are the security risks of using Rust in your supply chain and how to mitigate them.
entry.title: Rust Supply Chain Security

entry.content: Understand asynchronous closures in Rust and how they relate to Box and Pin.
entry.title: Asynchronous Closures in Rust - Box and Pin

entry.content: Write a WebAssembly runtime in Rust that can execute WebAssembly modules.
entry.title: WebAssembly Compiler - Building a Runtime

entry.content: Write a compiler in Rust to compile a WebAssembly AST to binary.
entry.title: WebAssembly Compiler - Building a Compiler

entry.content: Write a parser in Rust for the WebAssembly text format.
entry.title: WebAssembly Compiler - Building a Parser

entry.content: Understand and parse a WebAssembly abstract-syntax-tree (AST) using Rust.
entry.title: WebAssembly Compiler - Text format and AST

entry.content: Improve build times by utilizing sccache and S3 to cache compilation results over multiply builds in your Rust CI/CD pipeline.
entry.title: Improve Rust compile times with sccache
